title: Coordinator, Fitness Center
description: Front Range Community CollegeCoordinator, Fitness Center - Westminster CampusWho We AreWe are the largest community college in Colorado, enrolling close to 28,000 credit students annually. We were one of 30 colleges in the initial American Association of Community Colleges Pathways Project, recently selected as a “Most Promising Place to Work” in Diverse Magazine, and profiled as one of six top community colleges for transfer student success in a recent Aspen Institute publication. We have developed a strong strategic plan focused on improving student graduation and transfer rates and have made significant investments in advising and other student support programs.We also have a strong commitment to inclusion, equity, and diversity. We are actively seeking to hire a workforce that matches our student community and will support our Philosophy of Inclusion.We are guided by the philosophy “One College, Many Communities.” Campuses share many common values, goals, and practices, but are also given the opportunity and flexibility to develop unique cultures and programs that serve individual communities. In addition, we have a clear vision outlined in its strategic plan. For more information, visit the following: www.frontrange.edu and VISION 2020.Who You AreAs the Fitness and Wellness Coordinator, you will play an important role in creating an engaging and transformative student experience that aligns with the college’s Vision 2020. You will work to create programming and maintain an optimal facility and environment to promote student wellness and health. Moreover, you will also provide collaborative programming and recreational wellness opportunity for faculty and staff encouraging mental and physical well-being. Lastly, you will work with local health organizations to remain current with regarding program offerings and health related information.SELECTION PROCESS: Position will remain open until filled with a priority deadline of July 20, 2021.In your application, please include a resume and cover letter that specifically addresses how your background and experience align with requirements, qualification and responsibilities of the Fitness and Wellness Coordinator.SALARY: Low to Mid $40’s annuallyBENEFITS: 2020 - 2021 APT & Faculty BenefitsPrimary Duties Increase student engagement through campus-wide marketing and promotions efforts for the Fitness Center. Create and foster connections with faculty, staff, and campus departments, as well as community organizations, to create engaging programs and activities with students. Manage and create scheduling of Non-Credit/Co-Curricular Courses, Programs and Events. Manage front desk operations. Hire, train, supervise, and evaluate student workers to provide support for front desk and facility. Meet regularly with the staff and create a supportive environment for personal and professional growth. Manage the Fitness Center budget with the Assistant Director of Student Life. Maintain and keep records for the equipment and facility. Required SkillsREQUIRED COMPETENCIES: Facilitation Skills: Create and lead presentations and workshops on the subject of health and wellness. Process Management: Develop, coordinate, and implement guidelines and processes for utilizing the Fitness Center. Assess risk management for student wellness programming and events. Relationship Building: Create connections with faculty, staff, and students to host fitness and wellness programming. Supervise staff, and connect with students about co-curricular and intramural sport opportunities on campus. Event Planning: Navigate FRCC procedures and processes to have impactful wellness and fitness events/ activities. Provide support to faculty, staff and students as they host these types of events on campus. Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion: Foster an inclusive commitment to safety and dignity of each individual that is a member of the FRCC community. Create an environment that is welcoming and respectful to the whole FRCC community, particularly for historically marginalized populations. Required ExperienceREQUIRED EDUCATION/TRAINING & WORK EXPERIENCE: Bachelor's degree One (1) year full-time experience within student affairs or two years or more of part-time work within student affairs Ability to work flexible hours. There are a small number of evening and weekend commitments. Knowledge of fitness and wellness program specifically focused on student wellbeing or higher education student affairs models. Effective interpersonal skills, with the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships. Commitment to diversity, inclusiveness, and equity; ability to work with a diverse college community. Preferred Education/Training & Work Experience Personal Training/Group Fitness & CPR/AED/First Aid Experience working in fitness/wellness in a college setting, or parks and recreation setting. Supervisory experience. Welcoming. Respectful. Inclusive. Together, we are FRCC.

title: Operating Officer
description: Ambitious and vision-driven. That’s a Skylr Infinite Chief Operating Officer. Are you someone wanting to drive the vision of an exciting startup? This role is for you!Position OverviewWe are looking for a motivated, driven, and ambitious Chief Operating Officer who is passionate about the gaming and online space to join the Skylr Infinite family to oversee and maintain the company’s day-to-day operations, to build on and grow both relationships and business opportunities, and to position Skylr Infinite and its family of brands in the best way possible for our objectives.This position is a very entrepreneurial and business-driven role, working around both the leadership team and entire family at Skylr Infinite, so if you are someone who likes taking lead, has great business acumen, and would love to drive a new startup with huge potential forward, this role is perfect for you. With this position involving a range of exciting activities to run, grow, and develop a startup, you’ll play a huge role in the Skylr Infinite family, and be engaged and involved throughout the entire company, making a direct positive impact to a fast-growing business.What you’ll be doing as a Chief Operating Officer at Skylr Infinite:Discovering and exploring new markets, growth areas, trends, partnerships, innovation opportunities, and new ways of reaching the top of industries.Working with the CEO, alongside the leadership team, to keep the business always moving forward and running at full speed.Collaborating with channel-specific teammates (blogging, social media, etc.) to push company objectives.Researching, identifying, and acting upon new business opportunities throughout Skylr Infinite.Setting out and following through with brand strategies to achieve our company visions.Delivering changes, enhancements, and suggestions to elevate the business.Working alongside the CEO and leadership team around funding ventures.Building, growing, and sustaining relationships throughout the business.Overseeing and maintaining day-to-day operations of the company.Alongside working in these areas, we’re looking for someone to be engaged throughout Skylr Infinite and help our efforts and movements throughout the entire company. quality control CMS management Digital asset management and indexing Excellent organization skills Able to develop, organize, and maintain process documentation Proven dedication to meeting deadlines done Eager to learn and open to new ideas and innovation Able to maintain a positive, solution-oriented demeanor, even when load is high Familiarity with Apple programs and products is a plus – we only use Apple Familiarity with Jira, GatherContent, Bynder, Mailchimp, Buzzsprout, and Vimeo is a plus Why TIGNUM Your work will have impact - If TIGNUM engages with something, it’s with the clear title: National Government Relations & Advocacy Officer
description: National Government Relations & Advocacy OfficerJDRF is the largest non-profit organization in the world that is exclusively focused on type 1 diabetes (T1D). At JDRF, we realize that a cure is not just a destination but a journey. Our goal is to progressively remove the impact of type 1 diabetes (T1D) from people’s lives and funding research into cures is our #1 priority. While we wait for cures, we also fund ground-breaking research that seeks to improve the lives of people with T1D.If you are looking to make a substantial impact in the lives of the more than 300,000 Canadians living with T1D, now is the time to join our team at JDRF.We’re currently seeking a National Government Relations & Advocacy Officer to join our team in this new role reporting to the National Director, Government Relations & Advocacy. In this role, you would be responsible for supporting the execution of JDRF’s government relations and advocacy plan, both at the federal and provincial level, to secure and leverage government funding for type 1 diabetes (T1D) research and to expand provincial coverage of T1D devices and treatment.In This Position, You Would Have The Opportunity To Measure, monitor and report on the success of the program based upon established metrics Provide input into the development of JDRF’s federal priorities within pre-budget submissions and lobbying efforts in support of the target federal priorities As per an established plan, execute outreach to elected and non-elected officials and other diabetes stakeholders Conduct ongoing research in the development of new and modifications of existing government funding opportunities Research and report on new policy or regulatory developments or changes that may impact any of JDRF’s funded programs Work collaboratively across all areas of JDRF, including staff and volunteers, to engage their participation in JDRF government relations priorities as appropriate Act as a staff resource to JDRF’s provincial advisory groups Work in partnership with JDRF internal marketing and communications to design communications tools and toolkits, including Advocacy emails, e-newsletters, social media and webpages Work in partnership with JDRF’s development and corporate partnerships teams to ensure timely reporting to donors and partners on use of funding directed at advocacy work Coordinate meetings, prepare agendas and draft minutes of meeting with committee members and/or other key stakeholders Coordinate the production and logistics of provincial/territorial/federal advocacy and awareness days as required by the strategy Ensure compliance with all ethical and relevant standards associated with the position Does this sound like the opportunity you’ve been waiting for? If you have the following qualifications, we’d love to hear from you! University degree in political science combined with 3 - 4 years of progressive related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience; Demonstrated knowledge of government and its decision-making processes, regulatory and legislative process and structure; Superior written and verbal communication skills; Demonstrated experience preparing written communications such as reports, factsheets, briefing notes or related items; Proficiency with MS Office Suite; Bilingual ability (English/French) is an asset; Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as in a collaborative environment; Strong attention to detail and follow-through; Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced team environment; Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality and security of all information. Location: Flexible within Canada; All JDRF employees are currently working remotely from home due to Covid-19 restrictions and safety precautions and will continue until it is safe to return to the office environment.Why choose JDRF?At JDRF, we foster innovation and strive to think differently while working towards our mission in a collaborative, dynamic and positive work environment. Each day, we live our core values of Respect, Understanding and Integrity; Perseverance; Collaboration; Risk Taking and Entrepreneurship; and Efficiency, Effectiveness and Accountability. We prioritize growing our talent from within and strive to provide development opportunities to our team. We also offer a competitive compensation package including (employer paid) group benefits, group RRSP matching program, paid annual vacation, professional development opportunities and flexible working arrangements.Ready to apply? Please submit your application online by July 20, 2021. JDRF is also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free selection process and work environment. Please advise if you require any accommodation measures to ensure you will be interviewed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to accommodation requests will be treated with confidentiality.Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Required SkillsRequired Experience

title: VP Care Transformation
description: As VP Care Transformation, you will partner with the Medical Group to design and develop modern, asset-light care delivery models. Build foundational clinical, operational, and financial model for a borderless health delivery network. Tune the elements of the delivery network to engage and meet the needs of the communities we serve. Collaborate with Revenue Cycle and Finance to ensure fiscal viability and with Health Information Technology (HIT) to ensure digital security and scalability.Scheduled HoursThis role can be based anywhere in our system: Southeastern WI or Northern IL preferred. Recruit and develop a team that will impact the care continuum including ambulatory, acute and continued health (post acute).Work collaboratively with operational and clinical leaders in the medical group & acute sites to create an operating model that integrates virtual/tele health and digital therapeutics in a seamless fashion.Expand the reach and footprint on the clinical delivery model to new markets.Work collaboratively with digital/consumer experience team to develop new workflows on patient intake and develop new clinical care services.Stays current with trends and advances in care delivery worldwide.Responsible for making critical decisions during design, testing of new care models and serving as liaison to executive leadership.Business Hours. This role can be based anywhere in our system: Milwaukee, WI or Chicago, IL area preferred. Education RequiredBachelor's degree in Health Care Administration or related field.Experience RequiredTypically requires 10 years experience in ambulatory, post-acute and acute environments. Typically requires 5 years of management experience in administrative and operational leadership.Knowledge, Skills & AbilitiesClinician with extensive administrative and operational leadership experience OR non-clinical operational leader/consultant with in-depth experience in ambulatory, post-acute and acute care environments. Experience in change management with particular emphasis on patient facing services. Experience working with leaders across a large system including Functional Departments, Service Lines, Medical Group and Hospital administrative and physician heads to identify areas of opportunity to ensure success of business strategies outlined in partnership agreements. Demonstration of an entrepreneurial spirit. Ability to build and hold strong relationships with internal stakeholders and collaborate effectively to achieve organizational goals and targets. Ability to serve as change management champion.

title: Videographer
description: The North American Guitar—home of the world’s finest guitars—is looking to expand its team in Nashville, Tennessee, USA, with an awesome videographer capable of creating both long- and short-form cutting-edge films that show our passion and knowledge of acoustic and electric guitars. This role is a critical part of the marketing team, sitting at the heart of everything we do. Content is one of the most important ways we market our stock and high-quality video that reflects the tone and values of The North American Guitar is our biggest engagement driver. This is a great opportunity to be part of a fast-growing, private equity-backed, online guitar retailer and have autonomy to create short-from demos of all our stock, travel across North American to create feature documentaries with our luthiers, ideate and execute compelling social content, and film interviews / sessions with the most notable players on the planet. You’ll work directly with our Content Manager in our Nashville showroom, owning all pre- and post-production. You’ll build a video content calendar with the sales and marketing team and ensure that every day we have new video content being published to engage, educate, and entertain. You’ll also be expected to lend a hand with still product photography alongside the rest of the team. You’ll need to be a proactive videographer with a keen eye for new angles, have amazing organizational skills (you’ll be planning a lot of content and organizing a lot of people), and the confidence to work with people to get the best out of them on camera. Knowledge of the guitar market is a plus, but not a requirement. The main thing we’re looking for here is an exceptional videographer with the ability to plan pre-production and execute post-production on a variety of guitar videos. We have amazing players in house—we need the amazing videographer. Requirements:Take briefs from team members for content and marketing campaigns.Run the video output calendar and organize people, product, and processes.Manage all pre- and post-production exclusively.Shoot still product as well as video.Bring new ideas to the marketing table to explore and push boundaries of content.Edit podcasts where needed to supplement the content calendar.Be the guardian of quality across all video output.Ensure tone and values of The North American Guitar is represented at all touch points.Manage audio recording and editing for all video content.Skills and qualifications:Demonstrable experience as a content creator and videographer.Working knowledge of all software, tools, and technologies in order to excel in both pre- and post-production.Strong administrative skills and the ability to multi-task and report on various different assignments and workloads.A high level of computer literacy, especially MS Outlook and Excel.Passionate and hardworking team player.High attention to detail and the ability to work quickly and accurately.Excellent time management and prioritization ability.Experience capturing and editing audio.Most importantly: a great creative with big ideas and the ability to execute on them. Additional information:Contract Type: Full time.Working Hours: 9am - 5pm Monday to Friday.Salary: Competitive bonus benefits.Job Location: The North American Guitar head office in Nashville, Tennessee, USA.

title: Office Lead
description: Overview: CommonSpirit Health was formed by the alignment of Catholic Health Initiatives (CHI) and Dignity Health. With more than 700 care sites across the U. S. & from clinics and hospitals to home-based care and virtual care services CommonSpirit is accessible to nearly one out of every four U. S. residents. Our world needs compassion like never before. Our communities need caring and our families need protection. With our combined resources CommonSpirit is committed to building healthy communities advocating for those who are poor and vulnerable and innovating how and where healing can happen both inside our hospitals and out in the community.Responsibilities Under general supervision, the Office Lead will provide administrative and clerical support for clinic operations; coordinate clinic functions and special projects, learning all aspects of clinic operations. Manage clinic staff on day-to-day operation. Assist in identifying and providing guidance in resolving operational issues. Efficiently direct patient flow throughout the clinic. Coordinate general front office activities including but not limited to; registration, TOS collections, verification of benefits, appointment scheduling, daily billing, daily reconciliations, and other related duties. Assist the Practice Manager to ensure appropriate staffing coverage at all times. Assist the Practice Manager with the new hire or reoccurring training processes. Assist the Practice Manager to facilitate training of new hires and other training initiatives. Provide direction and support to clinical staff as requested. Perform other duties as assigned.Qualifications*Education and Licensure* High school diploma or equivalent required.*Minimum Experience* 2 years related experience in a front or back office clinic setting required.*Minimum Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities* Ability to perform multiple tasks in one setting. Ability to work both independently and as a team. Ability to effectively verbal and written communication skills to staff, patients, vendors and other contacts. Demonstrate positive professional customer service in all patient, staff, and visitor contacts. Demonstrate the skill of patient confidentiality while handling all patient personal health information and records. Demonstrate working knowledge of health care administration concepts. Demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Office software. Possess a strong work ethic and a high level of professionalism. A team player who handles multiple projects simultaneously in a fast paced environment.DISCLOSURE STATEMENT:The above statements reflect the general details considered necessary to describe the essential functions of the job as identified, and shall not be considered a detailed description of all work requirements that may be inherent in position.CommonSpirit Health participates in E-verify.

title: Events Manager - Margaritaville Resort
description: Benchmark’s company culture is central to our management philosophy. Review distribution of in-house reports to ensure consistency and completeness of information.Attend weekly designated meetings. Communicates frequently with group contact and attendees to ensure expectations are met or exceeded.Coordinates vendors, obtains quotes, client contracts etc.Takes a proactive approach toward client satisfaction. Responds to all client evaluations rated fair or poor.Assists Director of Events with interviewing, training, supervising, reviewing planning staff and assigning group files. Monitor assigned work for accuracy and timeliness.Performs some administrative duties to include distribution of event orders, reports, filing, etc.Follow grooming standards maintaining a professional image in dress and mannerisms.MARGINAL FUNCTIONS: Perform other job functions as necessary to ensure property and company goals and guest expectations are exceeded.EnvironmentIndoors, climate controlled environment. Outdoors, with exposure to outdoor climate and elements.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS (as required by OSHA and ADA – US only): Requires frequent walking and standingOccasional reaching and balancing, for extended period.Requires occasional crouching, bending, and pushing/pulling.Frequent lifting/carrying of up to 10 lbs; with occasional lifting/carrying of up to 50 lbs.Requires frequent manual dexterity and gross motor skills, and constant vision, and hearingThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. title: Associate Program Analyst (Program Analyst 2)
description: Initial Posting Date07/06/2021Application Deadline07/18/2021AgencyOregon Housing and Community ServicesSalary Range$4,441 - $6,794Position TypeEmployeePosition TitleAssociate Program Analyst (Program Analyst 2)Job Description Oregon Housing & Community Services Associate Program Analyst [Program Analyst 2] Salem, OR Oregon Housing & Community Services (OHCS) is in search of a team-oriented and adaptable person who enjoys variety in the work that they do. If you’re interested in a challenging and fast paced environment where each day is different, this position might be right for you!This is a full-time, permanent position that is represented by the Service Employees International Union (SEIU)This recruitment will be used to establish a list of applicants to fill the current vacancy and may be used to fill future vacancies as they occur. WHAT YOU WILL DO The person in this position supports coordination and management of multiple Development Resources and Production funding allocation processes and is the coordinator of a few small legacy funding programs. In addition, they will support federal programs by conducting environmental reviews and tracking Davis Bacon in projects that must meet these requirements. The position serves as a program administrative rules coordinator for the Development Resources and Production section.This position assists program managers in planning, evaluating, managing and reviewing the allocation processes for several funding streams and other award system(s) to identify, recommend and take actions that will keep the processes viable and in line with current OHCS policy and direction, including; participating in completing independent research of changing federal and state regulations, population trends in the state and methods of funding employed by other governmental agencies; creating and leading work groups to analyze specific complex issues related to processes, either within OHCS or with other state and/or federal agency staff and private housing developers and consultants. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: All performed with an Equity & Racial Justice Lens Funding Process Administration Program Development & Administration Coordination of transaction documents for OR Department of Justice (ODOJ) reviews Federal Regulatory ProcessesWhat’s In It For YouSalary Range: $4,441 - $6,794A positive environment that offers opportunities for career growth and cross-training.An agency that supports and encourages work/life balance and overall wellness.Generous benefits package including, employer-paid health insurance, vacation and sick leave, ten paid holidays, three paid personal days, flexible spending accounts, and an employer contribution retirement plan ( PERS ). Get There Oregon : Oregon’s easy-to-use carpool matching tool and trip planner.OHCS commits to inclusive excellence by advancing equity and diversity in all that we do. We are an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employer and encourage applications from members of historically underrepresented racial/ethnic groups, women, individuals with disabilities, veterans, LGBTQ+ community members, and others to help us achieve our vision of a diverse and inclusive community.To request a copy of the position description, please contact: HCS_HR.Solutions@oregon.govWhat We Are Looking ForThe most competitive candidates will possess the following requested skills, experience, and knowledge:Working knowledge and understanding of affordable housing issues, multi-family real estate finance, development principles, and financial feasibilityAbility to continuously collaborate, improve and develop knowledge and skills, while adapting quickly to changing circumstances and processesExperience in conducting federal environmental reviews and/or Davis-Bacon monitoringExperience in interpreting rules, laws, and regulations and applying them to varying and complex situationsAble to interpret and write administrative rules associated with funding programs Ability for clear, concise, and professional communication with diverse customer base and key stakeholdersDetail oriented, with strong organizational skills and ability to multi-taskKnowledge of Microsoft Office applications and ability to adapt to other online tools and processesExcellent time management and organizational skillsGood oral and written presentation skillsAbility to reflect our values: equity, diversity, and inclusion MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (MQs) A Bachelor's Degree in Business or Public Administration, Behavioral or Social Sciences, or a degree related to the agency program that demonstrates the capacity for the knowledge and skills; and two years’ experience coordinating or administering a program OR Any combination of experience or education equivalent to five years of experience that typically supports theknowledge and skill requirements listed for the classification.How To ApplyExternal Candidates - Click "Apply" in the job announcement and create/update Workday profile.Current State Employees - You must apply through your employee Workday account.All Candidates, please attach your current resume and cover letter . (Failure to attach the requested documents will remove your application from the recruitment process) AFTER YOU APPLY Log in to your Workday account before the job announcement closes to see if you have any pending tasks or actions, and make sure to complete these tasks or actions before the job announcement closes. These can be found under the “My Applications” section.Be sure to check both your email and Workday account for updates regarding this recruitment WHO WE ARE Oregon Housing and Community Services (OHCS) is Oregon’s housing finance agency. We provide financial and program support to create and preserve opportunities for quality, affordable housing for Oregonians of lower and moderate income. Our vision is that all Oregonians have the opportunity to pursue prosperity and to live free from poverty.Across Oregon, housing has emerged as a paramount concern. The lack of available housing, high rents and high home prices are driving rapid increases in housing instability and homelessness. The data is clear: too many Oregonians are without a safe, stable and affordable place to call home.The Statewide Housing Plan is a bold new agenda that articulates how Oregon Housing and Community Services will pave the way for more Oregonians to have access to stable housing opportunities necessary for self-sufficiency. It lays the foundation for OHCS to be a data- and research-driven organization and proposes a new way of collaborating and focusing resources and energy to address the most pressing housing issues facing Oregon today. Our plan lays out ambitions goals to increase access o housing, including goals and strategies to prevent and address homelessness. AFFORDABLE RENTAL HOUSING DIVISION: DEVELOPMENT RESOURCES & PRODUCTION The Development Resources and Production Section of the Affordable Rental Housing Division administers federal, and state funded multifamily rental housing resources to facilitate the increased availability of safe, decent, and affordable housing for Oregonians with low incomes. The Development Resources and Production section administers competitive processes as well as other processes to dedicate funding resources. The section ensures policy objectives are met while meeting local needs and statewide priorities. The section also ensures long-term affordability through its financing. WHY JOIN US OHCS values a diverse and culturally competent workforce. We stand by our commitment to being an equal opportunity, affirmative action organization that does not discriminate against applicants of a protected class, including disability status and veteran status. We encourage Individuals of diverse backgrounds, who promote diversity, and inclusion join our agency.Our Vision is that all Oregonians have the opportunity to pursue prosperity and live free from poverty. Our Mission is to provide stable and affordable housing and engage leaders to develop integrated statewide policy that addresses poverty and provides opportunity for Oregonians.Our Core Values : Collaboration – Compassion – Equity – Integrity – Leadership – Transparency. WANT TO KNOW MORE? LET US HELP YOU! Your candidate profile, cover letter, and résumé are the perfect place to display your interest in the position and highlight the skills and experience you will bring, making you the best candidate for the position. Submissions are screened for consistency of information and communication skills at the professional level (attention to detail, spelling, grammar, etc.).The salary listed is the non-PERS qualifying salary range. If the successful candidate is PERS qualifying, the salary range will reflect an additional 6.95%. Please review the Classification and Compensation page for more details.Please save a copy of this job announcement for your reference, as it may not be available for you to view after the job closes. Adverse background data may be grounds for immediate disqualification.Work Authorization: OHCS does not offer visa sponsorship. If your employment authorization and documentation is contingent on sponsorship now or in the future, you will not meet DAS employment eligibility standards.Veteran’s Preference: Eligible veterans who meet the qualifications will be given veterans' preference. For further information, please see the following website: Veterans Resources , or call Oregon Department of Veterans' Affairs at: 1-800-692-9666 NOTE: If claiming veterans’ preference please be sure to check your Workday account for pending tasks or actions under your “My Applications” section.Employee is required to possess and maintain a valid driver’s license issued by the state where the employee resides or provide an acceptable alternate mode of transportation.Oregon Housing & Community Services employees are currently working remotely to the fullest extent possible due to the current health crisis. title: HSE Project Specialist
description: (With Strong Desire to Change the World)Available Benefit Options Include: Medical, Life Insurance, 401k, Vision, Dental, LTD, Employee stock ownership program.Employment Type: Full-Time (Probationary period of six (6) months)Want to work with a company dedicated to making the world a better place through the creation of a bio-based polymer? We are a rapidly growing biotechnology company currently expanding research, development and production facilities in Athens, Georgia. We manufacture bio-based polymers with a goal of replacing (yes, replacing) single-use petroleum-based plastics. Our biopolymers are made from renewable resources that are biodegradable and compostable.This Includes All Site HSE Activities Including But Not Limited ToHSE Project Specialist reports directly and work under the direction of the HSE Manager. The HSE Project Specialist provides leadership in development and maintaining industrial construction and plant health, safety and environmental related matters.Industrial construction, plant operations, laboratory safety, training, hazmat, HAZWOPER, chemical processes, emergency preparedness, fire prevention, site permit maintenance, and regulatory recordkeeping for RWDC establishments.Major Health And Safety Responsibilities But Not Limited To Act as liaison with teammates, customers, contractors and regulatory agencies as required. Supports Company’s commitment to a culture of safe work practices and safety excellence. Assist HSE manager in the development and implement HSE procedures for the plant, ongoing and new construction that meet and exceeds OSHA, NFPA, EPA compliance as required. Develop and maintain documentation required by OSHA and local safety authorities, including all OSHA recordkeeping and reporting requirements for primary and subcontractors. Assist HSE manager overseeing assigned projects, including construction of 4k and 25k modules, field operations, site safety, productivity, schedule, quality work, and trade contractor and supplier coordination. Will be required to assist in plant activities and/or other RWDC assets. Assist HSE manager in developing of HSE bridging document and contract management program. Provide support for contractor safety qualifications, worksite inspections and performance evaluations. Assist in the development of the RWDC HSE software, HSE global management system and HSE data. Act as liaison with RWDC Control of Work System. Coach, evaluate and enforce all RWDC HSE Programs. Assist HSE manager develop and lead job-site emergency response team. Assist HSE manager develop and lead a safety recognition program for subcontractors. Develop, maintaining, record and track all violations of health, safety and environmental rules, regulations, codes, and standards. Ensure corrective action for violations is taken in inexpedient manner and maintain in an electronic log. Develop and maintain a health, safety and environmental deficiency tracking system that monitors deficiencies until resolution. Develop and maintain a health, safety and environmental individual performance tracking system that monitors individual, team and companies’ deficiencies until resolution. Develops and maintains required HSE training programs and provides training to employees, new hires and contractors. Works with the HSE manager department to ensure that all HSE training is scheduled, and documentation is properly managed. Develop and distribute educational materials (HSE alerts, training shorts, CBT’s). Coordinates site safety metrics programs and assists in the communication to various site departments and contractors as necessary. Develop and assist in HSE policies and procedures for the construction of RWDC facilities worldwide. Promote employee engagement and communication regarding site HSE programs and performance. Assist and participate as required in the Safety Committee activities and meetings. Assist as directed in the accident and near miss reporting program and incident investigations. In partnership with contractors and/or RWDC head departments, performs incident investigations to determine root cause and corrective/preventative actions. Works with HSE manager to develop sound implementation plans to reduce risks. Provides selection criteria for purchasing safety equipment (including PPE) as well as guidance on proper use and maintenance. Under the direction of the HSE manager, partners with departmental management in reviewing existing and new policies and procedures, HSE bridging document at a department level, ensuring proper HSE requirements are met. Ensures NFPA code compliance for new and existing facilities. Leads site Emergency Response Teams (clean-up, rescue, medical, fire, etc.) coordinating training, practice drills and response equipment. Assist and leads the development and maintenance of the site’s emergency action plans and acts as alternate emergency coordinator for the site, if needed. Maintains current knowledge of new and pending legislation related to HSE. Recommends adjustments to current programs to enhance compliance. Analyze work processes and perform risk assessments. Implement controls to mitigate those risks. Assist in drug testing protocols.Environmental Maintains current knowledge of new and pending local, state, and federal environmental regulations. Proposes adjustments to current programs to ensure compliance. Coordinates and completes all applicable environmental reporting activities to include notifications, applications, permits, reports, records, and documentation. Ensures documents are properly maintained, collected, prepared, and submitted to applicable government agencies as required. Evaluates and recommends proper management/handling of new chemicals that may affect environmental permits and determine proper disposal. Oversees the HSE portion of the site hazardous and nonhazardous waste management and recycling programs. Monitor’s vendors and assists in preparation for transport. Ensures all applicable personnel are trained and/or certified as required by regulation.Job QualificationsEducation: Bachelor’s Degree in safety, Engineering, Science, Industrial Hygiene or other technical related fields is preferred.Extensive knowledge of OSHA, NFPA, EPA codes and standards. MUST be based on industrial construction and/or industrial process applications.ExperienceMinimum (3-5) years' working as an Industrial tradesman.Minimum (5-10) years' working as a Construction Occupational Safety Officer,Specialist or Technician with a minimum of three (3) proving years of direct experience in developing and providing relevant training to others with a competent person status (train the trainer required) for at least the following areas of competency: excavation, scaffolding, fall protection and rescue, hazardous energy, confined space and rescue, scissor and aerial lifts, health and hazard recognition, evaluation and control of chemical, physical and biological agents, cranes and hoisting, and personal protective equipment, First Aid/CPR and AED, RCRA (Hazardous Waste) required, DOT Hazardous Materials required, HAZWOPER Initial (40, 24 and annual 8-hour refresher) required,Fall protection competent person and Rescue required, Confined space competent person and Rescue required, advance Firefighting, prevention and rescue required.Train the trainer required. Training must be verifiable. Experience establishing and maintaining construction site safety management programs, emergency response plan, and other programs and paperwork required by OSHA, EPA and local codes & standards.Works under minimal supervision. Must have a valid US driver license. Must be willing and able to travel up to 90% mainly domestic. International travel might be required. Excellent driving skills and clean driving record is required.Licenses, Certificates, Registrations BCSP, ASP (Associate Safety Professional) certification preferred, must have completed the OSHA-500 course or OSHA-510, First Aid/CPR and AED required, Fit tester for respiratory program required, First Aid/CPR and AED required, RCRA (Hazardous Waste) required, DOT Hazardous Materials required, HAZWOPER Initial (40, 24 and annual 8-hour refresher) required, Fall protection and Confined space Rescue, Fire Prevention and rescue. Train the trainer required. Bilingual, English and Spanish required.Knowledge/Skills/Abilities Strong interpersonal, communication, influencing, planning, organization, and time management skills. Expert-level knowledge in creating HSE policy and procedures. Expert-level knowledge in conducting incident investigations and interviews. Expert-level knowledge reading engineering drawings and P&IDs. Strong interpersonal, communication, influencing, planning, organization, and time management skills. Expert-level knowledge of Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) requirements, National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) life safety code, and 29 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 1910, General Industry, and 1926, Construction or specialized/technical knowledge.Successful candidates must be flexible to work extended hours. Nights and weekends may be required. (We all work together to do whatever it takes to change the world!)Other RequirementsMust pass pre-employment drug screening, background investigation and physical exam.Must pass skills testing and certification for specific needs.In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.Why Work Here?RWDC INDUSTRIES, LLC is a rapidly growing biotechnology company that offers competitive salaries, benefits, and a generous stock ownership program. title: Environmental Coordinator
description: Under the direct supervision of the Environmental Director, the Environmental Coordinator will develop, implement, and coordinate environmental activities consistent with the Tribe’s goals of environmental justice and stewardship. The candidate will provide project coordination for environmental and water quality projects as required by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) General Assistance Program (GAP) and Tribal Clean Water Act (CWA) grants. This position is responsible for the implementation and management of outreach and education activities to engage Tribal Citizens, staff, and stakeholders in environmental programs as well as contributing to advancement of Tribal Environmental program goals and objectives as a whole.Responsibilities Develops, implements, manages, and monitors outreach of environmental programs. Implements the GAP and CWA grant activities for tribal community outreach. Develops informative outreach material including newsletters, brochures, and presentations. Incorporates environmental justice and stewardship best practices and protocols for the Tribe Provides high level administrative support to the Environmental Director to manage project budgets, supplies, and inventory. Assists in implementing environmental program goals through mixed media tasks and activities inside the office and out. Keeps abreast of environmental regulations for the safe handling, storage and disposal of solid waste and household hazardous waste, advises Tribe on best practices. Completes fieldwork and data collection activities in order to achieve environmental grant's objectives. Writes and implements environmental plans, creates reports, and reviews regulatory compliance documents.Qualifications And Expectations Must have a valid California driver’s license Minimum high school diploma or equivalent Must pass pre-employment drug test Proficiency in Office programs Moderate physical ability Experience collecting and interpreting environmental field data Uphold all principles of confidentiality. Adhere to all professional and ethical behavior standards. Interact in an honest, trustworthy and respectful manner with employees, visitors and vendors. Participate in departmental staff meetings, quality management activities, cultural and educational programs. Comply with policies and proceduresThe Los Coyotes Band of Cahuilla and Cupeño Indians Tribal Government is an equal opportunity employer. However, as permitted by applicable law, the Los Coyotes Band of Cahuilla and Cupeño Indians Tribal Government will at all times and for all positions give hiring, transfer, and promotion preference to qualified applicants in the following order: 1) Los Coyotes Band of Cahuilla and Cupeño Members; 2) Los Coyotes Band of Cahuilla and Cupeño Indians Spouses; 3) Other American Indians; and 4) all others. At-Will Employment: Employment with the Los Coyotes Band of Cahuilla and Cupeño Indians is at will and for no definite period. The employment relationship may be terminated at any time by the employee or the Tribal Government for any or no reason and with or without prior notice. Drug Testing: The Los Coyotes Band of Cahuilla and Cupeño Indians is a drug-free workplace. All employees are subject to drug testing. Background Investigation: All candidates and employees may be subject to a background investigation.

description: DescriptionBusiness and Marketing Manager AdventHealth CorporateLocation Address: 900 Hope Way Altamonte Springs, FL 32714Top Reasons To Work At AdventHealth CorporateGreat benefitsImmediate Health Insurance CoverageCareer growth and advancement potentialWork Hours/ShiftFull-Time, Monday - FridayYou Will Be Responsible ForSupports Executive Director with the organization’s daily activities within the scope of the organizations missionSupports AdventHealth physician well-being program development, marketing and deployment Schedules and forecasts planning for special events (in-person or virtual) that publicize the organization and its programsEstablishes fundraising and development goals, identifies potential donors or sources of funding, and plans outreach strategiesAttends key meetings and works with leadership regarding discussions for timely resolutions and reportingManages budgets of Coalition organization and eventsDevelop and operationalizes strategy for marketing; the organization, Conference, Book, PWSAT, Podcasts, E-Journals, Toolkits, Blog and any other developed program QualificationsWhat You Will NeedBachelor’s Degree3+ years in non-profit program management positionAdvanced expertise in Microsoft Suite programsAdvanced expertise in PowerPoint skills preferred, or technical aptitude to learn advanced skillsetAdvanced expertise in project management programsJob SummaryAdventHealth is the founding sponsor and sole member of a not-for-profit organization called the “Coalition for Physician Well-Being”. title: Senior Manager, Society Relations
description: The Opportunity:CACTUS is a technology company accelerating scientific advancement that believes in making research available to all communities worldwide. Our aim is to help the scientific community overcome the barriers of language, geography, and reach; spread research through innovation in technology; and create a meaningful impact on everyday life.A CACTUS brand, Impact Science offers solutions for science dissemination and engagement with peers, public, and policymakers for wider research outreach. We work closely with Society partners to drive impact and engagement:- We increase impact and engagement of content through research communication;- We increase member engagement and communicate value to Society members through marketing and outreach;- We design strategies to share life-changing research and ideas with new audiences.We are seeking an experienced senior candidate to represent Impact Science in the US market and sign new partnerships with Societies and Associations. A confident and ambitious professional with experience in strategic sales and business development, the ideal candidate is passionate about research communication and its potential to meaningfully impact lives.The Senior Manager, Society Relations will have experience working with Societies and Associations and will understand their unique needs and ambitions. An understanding of the research publishing ecosystem would be highly advantageous.Based in the US, this position reports directly to the VP, Global Academic and Society Relations.Responsibilities:Proactively reach out to Societies and Associations in the US market to build a pipeline of Society relationships and sign new Society partnerships.Expertly manage and develop relationships with existing partners to: a) deliver an excellent Society experience; and b) foster deep strategic partnerships.Promote Impact Science’s solutions and share our vision with the US market, through active networking and thought leadership.Actively participate in and organize industry and community events aligned to Impact Science’s mission and vision for research communication, Society impact and engagement.Champion the voice of the Society customer within Impact Science and CACTUS and advise our teams on new solutions and opportunities for Society partners.Closely collaborate with global delivery teams to ensure an excellent service and experience for Society partners.Monitor and identify policies, trends and opportunities in the market, including attending industry events as required by the business.As required, collaborate with marketing and communication teams on campaigns and activities to support business goals.As required, support the global team to build new partnerships in global markets.Work collaboratively with colleagues on ad hoc cross-functional and global projects, as required.Desired skills and experience:Experience in strategic/consultative sales.Confidence opening relationships with senior stakeholders and decision-makers.Experience with and, networks in, the Society and Association space.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills at both strategic and operational level.Capability to work independently to deliver revenue growth.Confidence in pitching, presentation and negotiation of new business contracts.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including virtual and in-person presentation skills.Highly collaborative, with experience working in a global team environment.Professional, organized and motivated.Some prior experience using CRM tools highly desirable.Domestic travel may be required in the US.About us:Cactus Communications is a technology company accelerating scientific advancement. We collaborate with researchers, universities, publishers, academic societies, and life science organizations. We offer AI-powered scholarly publishing solutions for journals and researchers; editorial, translation, education, and training solutions for researchers; strategic and tactical scientific content solutions to global life science organizations; and solutions for science dissemination and engagement with peers, public, and policymakers for wider research outreach. We also incubate seed-stage and early-stage startups that share our mission to solve global problems with science and technology solutions. We have offices in London, Princeton, Singapore, Beijing, Shanghai, Tokyo, Seoul, Aarhus, and Mumbai; a global workforce of over 3,000 experts; and customers from over 190 countries.Know about our Culture:The CACTUS culture is the glue that binds us together as we work towards the same shared goal.We are “One CACTUS”. You are a Cactizen regardless of where you work. We take pride in our diversity, respect each other, and call out bias whenever we see it. We focus on outcomes rather than formalities. Everyone is on first-name basis. We are selective and hire only those who share our vision and values.CACTUS has always been driven by its culture. It sets us apart and attracts people who want to maximize their potential at work and in life. It describes our unique work practices in three aspects: People & Life, Performance & Career, and Business & Leadership.Awards and Recognition:• Consistently ranked among the top 20 on the global list of the Top 100 Companies for Telecommute Jobs (Forbes.com) since 2016• Recognized as one of Asia’s 100 Most Admired Brands 2020 by White Page International (2020).• Recipient of two bronze Stevie® Awards (Most Exemplary Employer and Most Valuable Corporate Response) at the 17th annual Stevie Awards for Women in Business (2020)• Recognized as one of the Best Companies for Millennials by Times Ascent and Learning & Organisation Development Roundtable (2019)• Emerged as one of the top 10 companies determined as a safe workplace for women in India in a survey conducted by Rainmaker (2019)• Ranked #1 among India’s Great Mid-Size Workplaces by Great Place to Work® Institute (2017) Connect with us on, LinkedIn, Facebook & Instagram to remain abreast with the latest developments

title: Sales Development Representative
description: Perimeter 81 is looking for a highly-driven, resourceful and motivated Strategic Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our rapidly expanding, venture-backed startup located in Brooklyn, NYC.The Sales Development Representative will be responsible for driving new business opportunities by generating and qualifying new leads, as well as setting demos for the Sales Team. You will have a direct impact on the company’s sales pipeline, and act as prospective clients’ first point of contact proactively generating outbound leads through sales-led initiatives.The ideal candidate should have the ability to rapidly qualify and convert sales opportunities and a demonstrated interest in IT concepts including networking, security, cloud infrastructure, and VPN technology. If you are excited by challenges, enjoy achieving and setting new goals, and have the desire to develop your sales career, then this is the position for you. About Perimeter 81Perimeter 81 is simplifying network security for the modern and distributed workforce by transforming the outdated, complex, hardware-based network security technologies of the past into one unified, easy-to-use and scalable software solution. The team of security as a service experts comes together every day to deliver a truly innovative, world-class network security service. Our clients range from SMBs to Fortune 500 businesses and industry leaders across a wide range of sectors, and its partners are among the world's foremost integrators, managed service providers and channel resellers. We recently raised a Series B round of $40 million in order to further our efforts to simplify and modernize the way businesses consume cyber and network security. Job Description:As the Sales Development Representative you will be responsible for:Taking a data driven approach to reach decision makers in target companiesQualifying B2B leads and opportunities for the Sales TeamGenerating demos and meeting KPIs through email, cold-calling and networking outreachMeeting or exceeding monthly goals to maximize deal flow with outbound emails, calls, and meetingsWorking closely with the Sales & Marketing teams to create appropriate presentations and sales collaterals based on B2B customer needsMonitoring competitors and identifying opportunities for our SMB/Enterprise offeringsStaying up-to-date with new products/servicesProactively seeking new business opportunities in the marketCustomizing product solutions to increase customer satisfactionPresenting our company to potential clients at industry eventsConducting conversations with prospects in a consultative way; comfortable managing and overcoming objectionsProviding feedback on customers to optimize marketing campaigns Requirements: 2+ years of experience as an SDR (preferably in a startup environment) Native English speaker or native-level - required Demonstrated achievement in a B2B quota-carrying role Experience working within Salesforce and other CRMs Experience prospecting within LinkedIn Ability to work independently in a dynamic work environmentProven track record with outbound meeting scheduling Good IT working knowledge a plus (networking and cloud) Ability to solve tough problems and discover client needs Work directly with and make recommendations for business leaders and decision-makers Excellent communication skills with the ability to work in a fast-paced, team environmentCustomer-oriented and friendlyPerimeter 81 is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, or disability
industries: Computer & Network Security

title: Human Resources Administrator
description: DescriptionCadaret Grant has an opening for a Human Resources Administrator to join our growing enterprise! At Cadaret Grant, we offer our employees the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds their expectations.The Human Resources Administrator will provide human resources support in areas of benefit administration, onboarding, offboarding, reporting, and record keeping. This position will also cross train to provide support in other areas within the Human Resources Department as needed. Job responsibilities are generally non-routine, which requires the ability to organize, prioritize and manage day-to-day activities, while completing department projects and individual goals as assigned. This position works regularly with confidential company information including staff compensation.Principal Duties And ResponsibilitesUpdate the New Employee Checklist weekly and send out required benefit notices and reminder emails on benefits and 401k enrollments.Assist with terminating benefits for offboarding employees across the enterprise.Administer Cobra procedures for health, dental, vision, and flex spending plans and ensure notices are processed accordingly.Maintain ADP database and process employee changes.Assist in the administration and maintenance of the 401k plan. Process employee enrollments and terminations.Administer medical, dental, vision, and other voluntary insurance plans by handling participant changes, processing monthly benefits tracking reports, and assisting employees with benefit questions.Review benefit bills for accuracy and submit for payment to Accounts Payable.Assist with monthly benefit billing audit.Assist with new employee benefit orientations.Administer flexible spending plan, processes enrollments, maintain reports, prepare monthly reconciliation, and resolve any report discrepancies.Assist with administration of leave of absence procedures including disability insurance claims, follow through on the FMLA notification/designation process, and track leave. Maintain reasonable accommodations logs when applicable.Track and distribute Medicare Part D notices.Respond to employment verifications, approved surveys, or approved information requests.Monitor an oversee submission of daily health screening forms.Order name plates and name tags.Process and assign building access cards, including maintaining an accurate list of which specific access is assigned to employees, replacing access cards if needed, and terminating access at the end of employment.Manage parking for all Syracuse office employees including assigning parking for new employees, terminating parking for exiting employees, card replacement and general parking inquiries. Maintain an accurate tracking spreadsheet for all parking assignments, including parking pass number, vehicle make and model, license plate, department, costs etc.Process monthly expense reports for the HR credit card.Assist with administration of annual flu shot clinic.Assist with company events and parties including the coordination of food, vendor approval and logistics.Provide facilities management and administrative support to the department.Ensure employee personnel folders and benefit folders are up to date and organized.Organize and develop ongoing HR procedures and processes.Cross-train and provide back-up for other areas of the HR department.Maintain accurate records, company directories, HR related forms and procedures, ensuring accurate style guidelines are met.Provide status reports to HR Managers on projects/job duties completed and in process.Provide recommendations to improve department efficiency; and provide feedback on processes or programs that may be of interest to the company.Assist HR Managers with additional projects as assigned.Position RequirementsEducation, Skills And ExperienceMinimum of 4 years of college education, preferably in human resources management.Minimum 1-3 years’ work experience in human resources, benefits administration or equivalent combination of education and work experience.General knowledge of state and US labor and wage and hour laws.Excellent written and oral communication skills.Computer experience; particularly Word, Excel, and HR databases/report formatting.Experience utilizing ADP is preferred.Strong organization and attentive to detail.Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively while working in a fast-paced environment and changing focus throughout the day.High level of accuracy.Ability to provide an excellent level of customer service both internally and externally.Cadaret Grant, a FINRA member and independent broker-dealer headquartered in Syracuse, New York, is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Atria Wealth Solutions. Founded in 1985, Cadaret Grant serves nearly 750 financial advisors in over 450 branch offices with next-generation technology and support for their independent businesses. Cadaret Grant & Co. seeks employee candidates who are ambitious, dedicated, and spirited. Our collaborative culture offers community through shared goals and strong work ethics. To learn more about Cadaret Grant, please visit www.cadaretgrant.com.Atria Wealth Solutions, Inc. (Atria) is a wealth management solutions holding company focused on delivering a clear path to the future of financial advice for financial professionals, financial institutions and their clients. Headquartered in New York City, Atria’s broker-dealer subsidiaries empower financial institutions and independent financial professionals with a sophisticated set of tools, services and capabilities that drive growth. Atria’s broker-dealer subsidiaries include CUSO Financial Services, LP, Sorrento Pacific Financial, LLC, Cadaret Grant & Co., Inc., NEXT Financial Group, Inc. and Western International Securities, Inc. Atria’s subsidiaries together support nearly 2,500 financial professionals with more than $75 billion of assets under administration. For more information, please visit www.atriawealth.com.EOE

Develop training programs that insure that all department members are proficient in operating and maintaining lighting, sound, audio-visual, computer and telephony equipment. Understand and be capable of insuring that all laws, building codes, ordinances, policies, procedures, risk management and emergency procedures are followed. Possess an understanding of facility's electrical, mechanical and other systems. Be familiar with the principles and techniques of supervision, training, budget preparation and purchasing. Respond to routine, precautionary and emergency alarms from building automation and life safety systems. Follow and adhere to all safety precautions and procedures. Maintain an effective working relationship with clients, employees, exhibitors, patron and others encountered in the course of employment. Read and comprehend blueprints, drawings and other related materials. Follow oral and written instructions and communicate effectively with others in both oral and written form. Organize and prioritize work to meet deadlines. Work effectively under pressure and/or stringent schedule and produce accurate results. Be licensed and insured to operate a motor vehicle in the United States. Remain flexible and adjust to situations as they occur. Computer Skills Microsoft Active Directory Microsoft Exchange Cisco network infrastructure including Cisco Nexus switches, Cisco Wireless System, Avaya IP Telephone Environment Virtual Server Environment (VMWare or Hyper-V) Micros Point of Sale Systems Operate a personal computer using Windows, Office and other standard office equipment. Must have strong computer skills. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. title: Registrar, Hult International Business School
description: RegistrarThe OpportunityThe Registrar has a vital role on campus, working with students, faculty and administrators to set class schedules and maintain student records. Positioned in a busy office, this role requires a flexible and proactive individual with an extremely high attention to detail, ability to work at a fast pace, desire to juggle multiple demands simultaneously and enthusiasm to help students and faculty with requests in the moment.ResponsibilitiesMaintain student academic records in the Student Information System, which is based in SalesForce, including but not limited to matriculating students, enrolling students in courses, entering student grades, updating information, managing withdrawals and leaves of absence.Act as a guardian of student recordsProvide technical support to students regarding schedules and course registrationCoordinate with faculty and registrars on other campuses to assemble the academic schedule for core courses and electives for this campusDetermine students’ eligibility for graduationTrack students on academic probation and at risk of being dismissed.Assist in the collection of grades from faculty and cross-checking before reporting to studentsProcess surveys and course evaluationsIssue formal letters and documents to students as requested, including the verification of past degreesPrepare and distribute diplomas and transcriptsAssist members of the Academic, Careers and Visa teams in providing students with relevant academic advice and informationProvide excellent customer service to students, staff, and facultySporadically to help other members of the Campus Team to staff special eventsUndertake any other functions not explicitly listed, but appropriate to support the academic administrationQualificationsTalents and skills: You believe in a global education and embrace cultural diversity in your school. You insist on the highest academic and service standards to provide your students with a transformational business education. Your students and peers trust and respect you. You are deft at explaining or enforcing school policies and can help your students make wise academic decisions. You are exceptionally well-organized, with excellent attention to detail. You are a team player and can work cross-functionally and collaboratively to incorporate the very latest innovations and best practices into our curriculum. However, you are also comfortable with taking initiative and being independent. You are results-driven and hands-on. You believe nothing is impossible—if you have the right attitude and a little entrepreneurial spirit and are a creative problem-solver. You are excellent at written and oral communication with developed presentation skills You thrive under pressure and enjoy fast-paced work environments.Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree is preferred. 2-3 years of experience in relevant higher education roles. A proven track record in administration and experience in an academic environment is preferable. International work or study experience is a big plus. Proficient in use of standard software to manage data, interpret reports, and generate professional, well-presented documents and presentations, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint Able to work from the San Francisco campus Able to attend occasional activities, events, and functions outside of normal school hours. Fluent English speaker with similar level in written EnglishApplication close date: Until filledPosition start date: ImmediatePlease note that you must have the right to work in the United States to be considered for this position. About UsHult is a new kind of non-profit business school that constantly innovates to meet the needs of students, employers, and society in a world that is changing faster than ever before. More than a business school, Hult is a dynamic and multicultural community that educates, inspires, and connects some of the most forward-thinking business talent from around the world.What We DoHult International Business School is a non-profit educational pioneer and the first triple accredited US business school. Ranked by the Financial Times, Economist, Forbes, and Bloomberg Businessweek, Hult offers undergraduate, graduate, and executive education programs across its global campuses in Boston, San Francisco, London, Dubai, Shanghai, and New York. The school’s philosophy is that business skills can only truly be learned by doing. By immersing students from all over the world in practical, hands-on experiences from day one, this fresh approach to education is creating a global community of confident, entrepreneurially minded graduates, ready to tackle the challenges of tomorrow.Solving problems and overcoming challenges is what our students do: all year, every year. We bring together creative, open-minded people from all over the world to find solutions to the world’s most pressing issues by doing business, not just studying it. So they graduate with the skills and the mindset to be ready for anything.And now we’re looking for talented workforce that think the same way.We seek to promote an environment for our students, faculty, and staff that welcomes people from all backgrounds, ethnicities, races, religions, genders, sexual identities, abilities, and personal circumstances in a spirit of inclusivity and belonging. At Hult, we believe that it’s through our diversity that we find our strength.Mission statementWe strive to be the most relevant business school in the world. By using our global reach and always being creative, entrepreneurial, and on the cutting edge, our aim is to have a positive impact on individuals and organizations by transforming their management practices. In so doing, we hope to be the business school of choice for existing and aspiring leaders. We will contribute to sustainable growth, helping leaders to integrate commercial success and societal well-being.Equal opportunities at HultHult is dedicated to actively creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing opportunity regardless of gender, religion, race, color, sexual identity, disability, ethnicity, age, and all the individual identities that make us unique. If you require any accommodation to assist you in the interview process, please submit this with your inquiry.Hult offers competitive salaries and benefits in a global, empathetic, and highly multicultural working environment. If you are motivated by the prospect of an international career with a dynamic and forward-thinking school, we’d love to hear from you.LegalHult International Business School is a 501©(3) non-profit educational organization registered in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, accredited by the New England Association of Schools and Colleges (NEASC) to award U.S. degrees. Students are awarded a joint U.S. and U.K. degree on successful completion of the program. The U.K. degree is awarded by the Ashridge (Bonar Law Memorial) Trust, known as Ashridge, with which Hult has a strategic alliance.
