title: Performance Delivery Director
description: Job DescriptionPerformance Delivery DirectorAs a Performance Delivery (PD) Director you'll be an individual contributor delivering business assessments and operating model transformation. The incumbent will have an entrepreneurial spirit while leading significant, cross-functional projects. There will be a heavy emphasis on aligning people, process, and technology initiatives while routinely using significant judgement on sophisticated business problems requiring advanced understanding of the functional areas involved. A broad knowledge of multiple disciplines is required to proactively negotiate across functions to influence priorities, timeline, and expectations. You will regularly interact with business leaders and their teams to deploy solutions to drive impactful business value.The TeamPerformance Delivery is a Center of Excellence responsible for the development and deployment of leading practices and solutions within Fidelity Investments Workplace Investing (WI) business unit. We partner with WI’s Sales, Service, and Transaction Processing core functions and many supporting functions to deliver value across a broad portfolio of cost and revenue improvements while focusing on risk reduction, quality improvement, customer satisfaction, associate experience, and strategic enablement. The experience gained and network developed while working cross-functionally builds the team’s capabilities and brand as corporate athletes, supporting Fidelity’s commitment to firm mobility.PD delivers measurable value by offering industry-leading business performance capabilities delivered by top-tier talent that are highly collaborative with our business partners. The elite talent on the team embraces a culture of associate ownership of the Performance Delivery practice and shared ownership of the functional business goals and objectives. Each team member plays an important role in building the team’s bench strength, standards and best practices, efforts toward diversity and inclusion goals, and career development. And they have fun doing it!The Expertise You HaveOperating model design, redesign, and improvement (7+ years) – familiarity of six sigma, lean, agile, and quality management methodologiesProject execution and delivery – bias for action measuring success on positive business outcomes through delivery of complex projects and programsFacilitating process and technology integration with expertsFinancial Services / Benefits Outsourcing industries experience is a plusBachelor's degreeThe Skills You BringAutonomy and ownership – takes the lead, owns the outcome, and partners across the organization to influence all levels of management and peersProblem-solving – understand objectives and bring innovative, yet realistic solutionsOrganizational change – influential leadership with refined organizational intuitionCuriosity – learn and uncover the root of exciting and often ambiguous business situations through respectful questioning, research, and investigationBusiness value analysis and financial modeling skills – including cost analysis, value frameworks, data analysis, critical thinking, modeling, and data flowsCommunication – verbal and written for executive presentations and experience facilitating large, cross-functional working sessionsThe Value You Deliver Lead and mentor business teams to identify challenges, understand current state, develop future state solutions, and execute on the most impactful changesStrategically and tactically involved throughout the life of a project from idea generation through full executionResearch, test, and develop standard methodologies for Performance Delivery associates to use as they approach business challenges and deliver value across our organizationCertificationsCompany OverviewAt Fidelity Investments, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. As a privately held company with a rich 75-year history, our mission has remained the same since our founding: to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.Join UsAt Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning and growth so you can build the career you’ve always imagined. We welcome associates from different backgrounds and with different perspectives to help us innovate and make a difference for our customers and our communities.We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Leave of Absence/Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations @fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 2.

title: Bookkeeper Junior Accountant
description: Junior Associate About The CompanyPretty Books is a tech-forward and non-traditional accounting boutique in Seattle. We combine modern accounting expertise with a passion for high-tech financial solutions to help businesses define, structure, and improve their everyday and long-term financial operations. Our clients are from various industries - particularly real estate, property management, medical and dentistry, technology, and retail. Our work ranges from basic bookkeeping to controller to CFO consulting.Our practice is growing fast, and we are seeking a qualified accountant to join our team.Our CultureYou will be working in teams. Certain work requires more than one person to ensure success. You are a team player. You share knowledge and provide perspective. You are transparent and communicative.We are people people. Our clients expect us to be empathetic. You genuinely care and are curious about our clients. You are compassionate and patient. You express a sense of urgency and set priority accordingly. You enjoy talking and checking in with our clients.The intrapreneur mindset. As a startup, we are not shy in exploring new ideas and processes for the betterment of our work and relationships. You are adaptive and changing. You are a problem solver. You take the lead to identify things that can improve. You are not afraid to voice ideas and solutions.You are tech-forward. We are a company that uses technology, implements technology, and explores new technologies. You pick up new tools and technology easily. You navigate the internet with ease. You are a ninja at navigating various software and tools. You are on top of Slack, emails, and agile platforms.Our Driving PrincipalsWe have three goals - to deliver the highest quality work for our clients, to have pride and personal satisfaction in what we do, and to be people driven by real passion.We are big on growth and encourage continued education and professional development to all team members. We offer a flexible schedule and promote personal responsibility.We believe in the sharing of knowledge and constructive feedback.Job SummaryThe Junior Associate possesses financial and administrative acumen. You have experience working in a startup or a firm. You will be responsible for the bookkeeping, back office management and customer service for our clients. You will assist with month-end close and manage client communication and correspondences. This is a client centric position with an emphasis on quality customer service and communication. You have an appetite for growth and are eager to test your potential.Customer Service For this role, you will assist with general client requests and concerns. You are interested in maintaining client relations and confidence, specifically for “high-touch, high maintenance clients.” High maintenance clients are growing companies that are characterized by their ever-evolving environment. These clients require accurate high-level financials and intensive day-to-day support. In addition, you will be expected to manage incoming client requests, manage communication and support in drafting meeting agendas. The work requires an attention to detail and a natural desire to deliver high quality customer service to ensure client satisfaction. Professional email correspondences Read, interpret, and identify client requests and concerns Professional telephone etiquette Follow up and follow through on outstanding requests Professional written and verbal communication Draft meeting agendas Note taking and documentationsBookkeepingAs the Junior Associate, you will be responsible for the record management and bookkeeping for our clients. This include management and support for month-end close and financial reporting for a variety of clients. You are responsible for the day to day bookkeeping, record keeping, bank reconciliation, account payable, account receivable and general data management. Manage and oversee GL reconciliations. Data import, input, and management Record and receipt management Reconcile bank, credit cards and loans Management of prepaids and accrued expenses Customer invoicing and collections Vendor bills and check runs Assist with project deliverables and timeline Managing vendor W9s and assist with 1099-MISC processing Assist with payroll processing Assist with tax research as neededBack Office, Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable You will provide back office support to our clients. This means that you will manage their accounts payable, accounts receivable and documentation requirements. The amount of work and type of work will be dependent on your assignment. Your duties may include vendor and contract management, check runs, entering bills and receipt, customer invoicing and customer collections. Managing incoming bills Verifying and recording new bills into system Managing accounts payable aging Managing bill pay Reviewing customer contracts Generating customer invoices Customer collection calls Receipts and records management FilingAccounting Tasks Perform bookkeeping and general data entry Manage requests and correspondences Manage accounts payable for clients Manage accounts receivable for clients Process payroll and payroll taxes Setup and design bookkeeping processes Reconcile bank, credit cards, notes Prepare financial reports and statements Research state tax compliance Research, install, and diagnose the technology systems used by our clients Diagnose accounting and data errorsYour Qualities Organized Detail oriented Mathematically inclined Flexible Self-starter Independent thinkerJob Requirements And QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business with an emphasis in Accounting, or a related field and/or 3-5 years of experience as an accountant, accounting supervisor, or managerExcellent computer skills; experience in accounting software, Microsoft Office SuiteProficiency with accounting software and experience with software system implementation a plusExceptional knowledge of finance, accounting, budgeting, cost accounting and cost control principles, and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) is a plusExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAdvanced knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting best practices, laws, standards, and state/national regulationsQuickbooks, QuickBooks Online, XeroExcel (pivot table, index, v lookups, relationship between two tables in Excel)Pays strict attention to detailJob Details Full Time Health, Dental and Vision Insurance 401k Cafetria Plans 2 Weeks’ VacationPretty Books is a tech-forward and non-traditional accounting boutique in Seattle. We combine modern accounting expertise with a passion for high-tech financial solutions to help businesses define, structure, and improve their everyday and long-term financial operations. Our clients are from various industries - particularly real estate, property management, medical and dentistry, technology, and retail. Our work ranges from basic bookkeeping to controller to CFO consulting.

title: Social Media Specialist
description: A&S Motorcycle Parts Inc. is currently in search of a Social Media Specialist. This is a full-time position in the motorcycle/powersports industry. Current motorcycle brands we carry are BMW, Ducati, Royal Enfield and Triumph.Must have a working knowledge and genuine passion for motorcycles and the industry as well as fully versed in the use of all social media platforms.Responsibilities IncludeReports directly to the Sales ManagerEnvision and create compelling and professional social media content and related marketing campaigns that generate followers, increases dealership loyalty, and drives new customer leadsAnalyze and assess organic and paid performance trends across platforms.Stays up with current trends finding new creative ways to connect and engage our target audienceTaking photos of all incoming vehicle inventory, new and used, uploading and creating unique content for the website and social media forms.Qualifications2-4 years relevant social media experienceA creative mindset with strong analytical skillsResourceful, fast learner with the ability to apply larger understanding of the business goals to all social media platformsExcellent grammar and communication skillsProficient in Word, Excel, social publishing tools, graphics and web-based content creation programs.A&S Motorcycles Inc. offers paid holidays, paid vacations, health and dental benefits, 401k, and an incredible place to work in the Sacramento region for the right person.Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screening and background check. To apply please go to aspowersports.com, click on "about us", select "employment opportunities" and complete our online application.We are open 5 days a week, Tue-Fri 9:00am to 6:00pm and Saturday 9:00am to 5:00pmA&S Motorcycle Parts, Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer"It's about the ride."A&S Motorcycles opened its doors in 1968 as A&S Motorcycle Parts Inc., a motorcycle salvage yard - possibly the first in California. Anthony and Adrian Felice and Sheldon Pine founded the company and their first name initials provided it's name - "A&S". Our first location was in Folsom, CA and we expanded to an additional salvage operation on Franklin Blvd. in Sacramento in 1982. By 1988 we'd also been doing business on Auburn Blvd. in Citrus Heights and it was there that we opened the BMW motorcycle dealership along with the newly-revived Triumph brand, serving the greater Sacramento area. As our BMW business outgrew the available space in that store, we dropped Triumph motorcycles. Still more growth finally resulted in the move to our current location in Roseville CA in 1999. In 2009 we added Ducati motorcycles and in 2011, we brought back Triumph motorcycles, making us your one-stop shop for premium motorcycle brands!Through the years, one thing as never changed - we're family owned and operated by the Felice/Pine family. We even have employees who've been with us from the very start. If there were ever a shop with a wealth of experience and knowledge, A&S Motorcycles is that place!

title: Entry Level Field/Office Engineer - Kiewit Offshore Services District (Spring 2021)
description: Requisition ID: 114501 Job Level: Entry Level Department: Project Engineering Market: OGC Employment Type: Full Time Position OverviewAs a Field Engineer, you bring your big ideas, commitment to top quality and unwavering work ethic. In return, we offer huge career and travel opportunities and the satisfaction of building "the next big thing" from the ground up. There's a reason Kiewit attracts the best: we offer fast-paced excitement and fulfillment you won't find anywhere else. Our mission is to make a difference and we offer opportunities for you to make make a difference in our construction operations. Whether we’re boring tunnels through mountains, turning rivers into energy or building bridges that connect communities, we depend on our passionate, skilled, and safety-obsessed construction professionals to get it done right.District OverviewKiewit Offshore Services, a district (or business unit) of Kiewit Corporation that builds structurally complex jackets and topsides for offshore oil drilling rigs. Located in Ingleside, TX, 20 minutes outside of Corpus Christi, the 550-acre fabrication yard is the workplace of 300 staff employees and 1400 craft employees who work in the yard year-round. The projects built by Kiewit Offshore Services require significant equipment planning, detailed cost estimates and schedules, a commitment to safety by all employees, and are truly unforgettable. The Kiewit Offshore Services team is a diverse, tight knit group that enjoys fun team building events such as deep-sea fishing, golfing, and sporting events throughout the year. The employees are extremely schedule driven, high-energy, friendly, and hard workers.
